result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kolt I. Marlow

records.addlTxt:
11:12 AM Defendant Kolt I. Marlow in court.  Attorney Adam C Benson in court for Kolt I. Marlow.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin.  Case is on for preliminary hearing.  State calls first witness, Sergeant Clifford Casady, who is sworn in and testifies.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Venue is made.  Atty Benson crosses.  State redirects.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  The matter is bound over for further proceedings.  The State files information mirroring complaint. Case proceeds to Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
1:17 PM Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kolt I. Marlow in court. Def has not applied for PD, will obtain private counsel.  Def wants to proceed without counsel for today's purposes.  Court makes record.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to misdemeanors.  WTLPH.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
